website_summaries.verdict: This convenient product is a great option for those looking to use the desk for multiple purposes.
pros: Desktop can lift to five different angles
The leg height is adjustable and able to lock into place
Can be used as a laptop desk, breakfast tray, reading table, or portable easel
The eco-friendly bamboo offers users a sturdy working surface
cons: Built-in drawer has a tendency to slide out when desk is moved
Buyers complained about the product's heavy weight

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended For An Invalid
customer_reviews.text: While I love many of this tray's features, there are aspects that I hadn't expected to not be so great. I don't recommend this for an invalid with arm strength issues as the tray itself is really heavy and one needs some strength to move it off their lap. The locking metal slide for the legs does not hold well at all so the legs can collapse unexpectedly. The little side/under drawer is quite loose and has no locking mechanism. It slides in and out with the trays movement, which makes it an awkward feature, more than a helpful one. The tray's wood has not been sanded smoothly in areas and rough spots can be a factor with delicate skin.
customer_reviews.author: Von ReederTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this when it first arrived. After about a week of use, the leg (where it attaches to the table) snapped off! I wasn't putting it to any extreme use, I was simply writing blog posts while sitting in bed. It ended up being a big waste of money :(
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Solid wood POOR design.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality wood. However, any movement at all and the legs will come in. My daughter got her fingers caught and pinched HORRIBLY. I was going to return them both (I got 2, one for each of my kids) but much husband and I modified them so they wouldn't collapse. The little metal things to hold it open is a joke. It will not let me post a pic of our modifications. We took a 1x2 cut and notched it out to fit between the legs to force them to stay open.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love this lap desk! Perfect for coloring, etc.!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Exactly what I wanted for using in front of the TV, while I sit on the couch coloring, etc. I really like how the legs can be heightened. I like how the ledge that holds a tablet or book can be removed easily. The legs fold easily underneath. The drawer is very small and not all that practical, but it'll hold several pens/pencils, eraser and a pencil sharpener, but this doesn't really concern me. The overall quality of my desk is very good. No damage. No splits in the wood. Looks very nice for $43! Impressed and happy buyer!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It arrived dented. had many splinters coming. Out, but I thought I will never get hurt they are inside but today morning when I picked it up, it did! Very bad quality and dangerous. I paid for it :( I am glad I was able to take the splinter out myself. I am returning it. I saw one at Costco yesterday. I am sure that is going to be much better in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pari

customer_reviews.title: This One Has It All (for a lap desk, at least)
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and tall enough/short enough (adjustable works well -- it has little grooves for the tightening knobs so it doesn't slip) and a fair value. There's a removable ledge to keep stuff from sliding off the bottom if you have it tilted, too. The drawer might come in handy, but the jury is still out on that feature. This was the end result of a long search and I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Parkwood Lane

customer_reviews.title: It's Like Songmics Read My Mind
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for a natural wood lapdesk and am so glad that I finally found this one. It's very well made, highly functional, with tiltable split top and adjustible legs. Meets my needs perfectly. I have room for my Surface Pro 3 with keyboard/cover and mini- mouse as well as my cell and a drink or book. There's also a small drawer on the side that's good for storing pens and the removable wooden stopper. Now I can work in my living room, where there's air and light, instead of in my dreary study. WooHoo!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Ritch

customer_reviews.title: Not that great for the couch
customer_reviews.text: I like to work on the couch and sometimes sit cross-legged. I'm a 5'8" person and even at the highest height leg extension, it's not wide enough to fit over my knees. The little adjustment knobs constantly dig into my legs. the Drawer is too shallow for my slim-profiled mouse. the surface is very slick. The little metal armature that are supposed to hold the legs open, always slip out and makes it difficult to re-position. It's heavy and not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: The Lexus of invalid trays
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. It has everything. It's solid as a rock, and it held me when I cried. I now know I cannot live without this invalid tray. Every other invalid tray is a joke compared to this beast. Do not hesitate, guys, this thing will change your h*ckin life. Seriously though, if you have any doubts going by the seller photos or description, it arrives at maximum quality going off what's promised. It's not free, and it might not seem cheap, but dang is it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Century

customer_reviews.title: The design is pretty good but it falls short in several areas
customer_reviews.text: The design is pretty good but it falls short in several areas. The mechanism that is used to keep the legs stable and in place is a small rounded knob. The knob is small... rounded... and easily slips out. Putting any sort of drink or food on the side makes me feel uneasy. The leg extensions use a cheap plastic and if you turn too much, it loosens at a bearing point. Makes it feel like the whole thing is going to break. Overall, there are some fatal flaws in this product. The design is poor and the manufacturing makes it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Eze

customer_reviews.title: This was a nice idea but the wood on one of the legs ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice idea but the wood on one of the legs split the second time it was used. Of course right after the 30 day mark when we can no longer return it. I liked the concept and design but the quality was lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Erin G

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, though design could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lap desk, way better than the cushioned kind which rests on your lap and makes you sweat. I don't understand the thinking of putting the tilting section of the work surface on the left hand side. I think I'd find it much more comfortable with the tilt on the right hand side (I'm right handed.) The little storage drawer with magnetic closure works great and makes this a great way to get some work done in front of the TV, which I frankly do all the time. Maybe there's a "left-hand" version that I'd find more comfortable?
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: this is a very attractive and cleverly made piece - i am pleasantly surprised. the only negative comment i have - and which keeps me from giving it a five-star rating - is for the brace against which one lays one's book: the dowels are too narrow for the holes (or vice versa!), so i am a little concerned about putting heavy books on it and how well the brace will hold. otherwise, it is a really nice piece for a bibliophile who loves to read in bed!
customer_reviews.author: horsewoman

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like--returned
customer_reviews.text: The locks for the legs are great, but you can't actually change the angle of them. That doesn't seem like a big deal, but it actually winds up being that your spine is ever-so-slightly twisted to the left because your computer is just a few inches to the left. I type with my keyboard centered in front of me and my mouse off to the side. As a lap-desk, this doesn't work. Since my goal was a more ergonomic space, I wound up returning this both because of the spinal twist and because it never quite fit my chair correctly due to the leg issue.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Chipped and broke the first week
customer_reviews.text: Was great for the first 2 days I had it then I noticed there was a chip on the side of the table where you could cut yourself. Then the stand cracked and broke. I barely used the thing and it sat on my bed the entire time. Great table design but poor build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: My issue with this is only one: the legs do not lock properly and it constantly falls over. Other than that, it's lovely but I pretty much bought it for the expendable legs.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Viola

customer_reviews.title: The perfect lap desk!
customer_reviews.text: This desk is exactly what I needed! There are times when I like to catch up on work while watching TV, but sitting on the floor is the most comfortable way to do that. This desk makes really helps with that. I absolutely love that the height can be adjusted and you are not restricted to certain heights. I use different heights for different tasks (studying, working on the computer, crafting). This desk was worth every penny as far as functionality and durability goes!
customer_reviews.author: Monica  M.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I AM ON DIALYSIS 3 DAYS A WEEK AND I AM ABLE TO DO ALL OF MY OFFICE WORK IN THIS DOWN TIME WHEN ON THE D. MACHINE. MANY COMPLIMENTS ON IT WHEN OTHERS SEE IT..........ALLOWS ME TO LAY ON MY RECLINER AND STILL BE FUNCTIONABLE IN DOING OFFICE OR EVEN HAVING A SNACK. LIGHT WEIGHT....SMART LOOKING....PRICED RIGHT.....I JUST WISH IT HAD A HANDLE FOR CARRYING BUT WE HAVE A BAG TO CARRY IT AROUND IN. VEERY GOOD PRODUCT MADE OF GOOD WOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man from Turlock, Ca.

customer_reviews.title: This cracked after a month and a half!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this desk when I got it for Christmas! It is a bit heavy but I move it from room to room with no issues. I used it last night, and when I went to use it tonight it's cracked!!! Now there is a 6 inch crack, the top is bowed and the top is no longer flat! You can see where they glued pieces of the top together, so obviously one of these pieces warped. I am completely bummed.....
customer_reviews.author: george m schnell

customer_reviews.title: Defective top
customer_reviews.text: The two pieces that make the top of the “desk” are uneven at the ends. It still works for what I needed it for. I will think twice before I buy an item that says the packaging is damaged. It did not state anything about the item it’s self being defective.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great to work from home in bed or on couch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I use it to work from home. The item arrived already assembled, it folds easily, it's sturdy enough for typing on my laptop all day, it can be adjusted for several different heights, and the wood is really good quality. I was worried about splinters because some reviews mention getting splinters from the wood but there is only one area I had to file down because the wood is a little uneven -- otherwise its perfect!
customer_reviews.author: deeps

customer_reviews.title: Puuurfect
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple minutes to figure out how to adjust the table, seriously. I was annoyed there wasn’t instructions lol. I figured it out, though, and I use it pretty much daily now. I mean, my cat does. He perches himself on it and lays down. Makes studying difficult. I think he likes it more than I do. I do enjoy how conveniently it folds on itself to be put away. I wish the legs locked in place and it had more storage, although the little drawer on the side is cute. Maybe i’m asking too much and should invest in an actual desk. But for a lap desk, it’s great. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: No Issues Here
customer_reviews.text: I really love the table. I was afraid to buy it because some reviews said they had problems with stability, but I have not had any stability problems with this table at all and I think I've used it daily for a month now. The screws have not come loose, thankfully. The wood looks like it's pretty good quality. The surface is relatively smooth...I was afraid that there would be grooves in the wood, but that's not the case. I've seen far worse quality bamboo. I use it on a bed and the sheets haven't been torn up yet, so that's a plus. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Flamingomotel

customer_reviews.title: Heavier then expected
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product, however, it's heavier then I expected, weighs at least 5-7lbs. Legs are adjustable by turning 4 wing like nuts, so it's not quick. To get it to fold exact into itself legs have to be completely shortened, which once again means every time you will have to unscrew the wing nuts. Definitely not portable, too heavy but it is sturdy and I use mainly while I'm sitting in bed on the computer so I leave it at the bedside
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Register

customer_reviews.title: Great homework station!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter to use when she does her college homework. She lives in a very small apartment and there is not enough room for a desk or computer station so this is perfect. It is lightweight yet sturdy enough to hold her laptop & textbooks. It folds up for easy storage when not being used. I would recommend this to any parent with a child needing a table to study on.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase for working from home!
customer_reviews.text: Loooove this laptop tray! It’s great for using in bed, and is very sturdy and well made. I love that the height is adjustable. The only reason I gave it four instead of five stars is because one of the holes to lock the legs into place wasn’t aligned well, so I had to drill the hole a bit larger to make it work. Not a big deal, but an unexpected task.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Awkward height regardless of adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Well a) it gave me a splinter b) it’s too long to fit on a single couch cushion in any direction. I bought it to write on, but it’s not going to work for that. Should make an ok breakfast tray. Just too awkward for writing
customer_reviews.author: Shye Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Much flimsier than I had hoped. I have a larger gaming laptop (16 inches) I got the desk so that I could game at night before bed on the small desk. The desk is extremely wobbly. Even with the locks (little metal things to keep the legs held in a position) in place. Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Deeg

customer_reviews.title: Great for homework, reading, coloring...whatever.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful desk. I love that you can adjust the angle of the top, and the little book holder ledge is removable so it's not in the way when the tray is flat. Where do you put the little ledge, you ask? In the attached drawer! So handy. Also like that the legs are adjustable. I sit cross-legged and can't put it over my lap, but with the legs extended it's the correct height. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for drawing and homework
customer_reviews.text: The layout of my son's room does not allow us to put a desk in there. He said he wanted something like this so he could draw and do homework in his room instead of at the kitchen table. We picked this up, seems very good quality and he likes using it sitting in his bed or on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: The lap desk was exactly as described. It was well constructed and does not feel cheaply made. It feels very sturdy. My wife loves it, especially when she works on her laptop on our bed. My only gripe would be that there are some imperfections. For example when completley closed there is a small gap between the two boards of wood. And its not completely level from a viewing angle. It would've been 5 stars otherwise. Pro: Well made. Great for someone working from home. Affordable. Delivered promptly if a Prime member. Con: Slightly imperfect if you're fussy. *Watch out for delivery carrier because they will leave your order by the mailbox without notifying you.
customer_reviews.author: Damel W.

customer_reviews.title: Desktop stand
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a keyboard stand when I raise my monitors to turn my regular desk into a standing desk. Perfect solution for less than $35. When I'm not using it that way, I put it on the other side of my desk for people to write on when they fill out or sign paperwork. It's an issue for me, when people pull up a chair and take over my desk. I hate being rude, but when people sit, they tend to stay and chat. Unfortunately, I just don't have time for that. It's a non-verbal cue that this is drive-by space, not a parking zone.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha H.

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully made piece of furniture if you are looking for a solidly made, quite heavy little table. Could do without the drawer because it does not stay closed and gets in the way when you try to pick up the table from resting position. But the legs and the adjusting knobs are easy to use and it is stable for drawing. I would lengthen the size of the catch-bar on the draft-side of the table (that moves) for canvases in different sizes. The wood is beautiful...it's a little too heavy for my liking, but an excellent drawing table to have as a back up for any room or table in the house because it is so sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: LDN

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: this laptop desk is very nearly perfect. it's beautifully made; and, if you are sitting up as on a sofa or chair, it is just fine. i needed to use it in bed, though, when i was not sitting up straight, so then the angle of the tilt was a little too shallow for me to read my book. i will repurchase this if they find a way to increase the angle of the tilt.
customer_reviews.author: tessa

customer_reviews.title: Love the side drawer
customer_reviews.text: I love the little side drawer. Perfect to drop my cellphone in and, when open, hold my wireless mouse when I'm not using it. I love the bamboo, but wish they would put a smoothing laquer on it. I haven't gotten any splinters, but I'm scared to handle it, b/c I'm worried I'll get splinters. This needs to have a clear coat to smooth it. Other than that, I love it. I have a surface pro3 and I can disconnect my screen from my keyboard and place it on the raised section an fall asleep watching a movie. (I just had surgery, so I'm confined to a bed for 6 weeks.)
customer_reviews.author: Shan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Enables laziness
customer_reviews.text: I really like this desk! I've used it a few times and it's basically the only way I can get work done on the weekend (hello teachers!). I love that there's a drawer and the legs are adjustable. It's not super easy to change the leg height but to complain about it feels so silly considering how functional this thing is. UPDATE: I started using this everyday to teach from home. The 5 stars still stands! I can raise my computer so the angle is more flattering and it turns any desk into a standing desk. I would recommend laying down some drawer liners or fabric because the hinges will scratch the surface when not in "standing" position.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Holl

customer_reviews.title: It is beautiful, it is easy to fold down or set ...
customer_reviews.text: This little lap table FAR exceeded my expectations. It is beautiful, it is easy to fold down or set up, it is adjustable in height and seems very well made. I got it as a meditation 'altar' to hold incense and to lay my mala beads on, set a candle on, etc. I had priced several pieces of furniture especially made for htat purpose and they were ridiculously overpriced and then saw this. And it is perfect. I even used it as it was intended (lol) and it works fantastic for both purposes. Very, very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WholisticMom

customer_reviews.title: ELDERLY MOM IN BED LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your typical run-of-the-mill bed table. THIS is a multi-purpose bed table with a drawer and it slants for use of a tablet or to do work or art-work, AND the legs log. It is VERY STURDY and well-built. I am VERY HAPPY with this purchase. It is very useful and plan for a long use. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: SurreallyReal

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy. Real wood feels like a little wooden master piece. Smooth and super useful for anything you like to do in bed...ok, maybe not everything but you are getting the drift :) Cons: after using it for 2 months...it soon becomes very wobbly as the holes that hold the legs in place widen. For me (5'3")it is to high, I find it too heavy to move around and I am just done "fighting " with it...using my old laptop board again.
customer_reviews.author: Marina M

customer_reviews.title: Great Functional Design!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before I knew I would be laid up after surgery. What a great design! This is good for artwork or writing, perhaps even small crafts while in bed or reclining, I love the slanted half table and the hidden storage drawer as well. I am so glad I found this useful bed table.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this table!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy that I purchased this table. It’s easy to adjust the legs to different heights as needed and folds up for storage. The table is very sturdy, constructed well, and made from quality materials. I haven’t had any issues with the table at all. I absolutely love this table! I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio13

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good bed table.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have ever bought. It is sturdy and adjustable. The table is well made. I enjoy typing in bed on my laptop and the table stays pretty grounded while in bed. I also have my Kindle on it sometimes. So the table is good for all devices as well as paperback or hardback books. My only problem is storage of the table, it is slightly difficult due to adjusting the height size. But this one small problem doesn't affect my score of the table which is 5 out 5.
customer_reviews.author: Read more books

customer_reviews.title: Just OK...
customer_reviews.text: This desk is really heavy for what I needed and the part that lifts up isn't large enough for my computer, so I can't use it for that. The legs are not all that stable because of the mechanism to change the heights. I mainly bought it for when my husband had shoulder surgery, thinking it would be good for him to eat off, but the legs don't quite fit his expanse as he's a large man, not heavy just a big guy.
customer_reviews.author: AP in OB

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: The material is good quality but unfortunately it’s just not working out for my needs. When you pick it up you have to be very careful otherwise the door opens on you and your fingers can get caught in between. This is not for someone in the elderly population to use as a table tray because it’s too heavy and awkward. This is a good product for young person who might be sick and wants to keep some entertainment items by their bed like a journal or sketchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Great in concept
customer_reviews.text: Great in concept. The legs don't go quite low enough though, and the metal pieces don't hold the legs folded in place well enough. I do like the tilting stand though. That's a very handy feature for raising the screen of a laptop up more to eye level. Less strain. The drawer is a joke. There's a middle piece, to keep it from falling out, that blocks anything bigger than a matchbook. And it's too shallow to hold anything TALLER than a matchbook even if the middle piece weren't in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Sojum

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than the price tag entails
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is well worth it if you work from bed often. Pros: -solid bamboo construction with laminated desktop (craftsmanship seems better than what I expected) -good quality joints -collapsible (legs have to be adjusted to fold it all the way up) -cool little storage drawer The only things I didn't particularly care for are: -thumbscrews which adjust legs are a bit cheesy -it is definitely on the heavy side which can be good depending on what you use it for Overall, it is a simply constructed piece of furniture that I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made and designed desk
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this desk delivers. Sturdy, and seemingly well made. I have only used it a week but I am already in love. It allows me to work outside with ease, or watch videos in bed without overheating my laptop. I can draw, write and compute anywhere I choose. Small enough to pack to the beach or onto our boat. I previously purchased metal lap desks that shortly fell apart, and I have used lap pillows. This far exceeds anything those ever delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This tray is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I use it with my laptop when I'm in my recliner. Stays in place with legs that lock, so it doesn't fold up in use. I really appreciate the adjustable tilting top. Works well for using, not only my laptop, but for a book or my tablet. It is made of bamboo, making it beautiful, strong and made of a sustainable wood. The price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryCat

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Cons: One of the latches that holds the leg stand in place is loose but it has not bothered me much. In that same area is about 2 square inches of bamboo that was not sanded and I'm careful not to get a splinter until I sand it down. Pros: Sturdy even with the loosened latch mentioned above, good size and overall I'm please with the quality and the low price. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: dedos23

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the magnets
customer_reviews.text: I love this table. I use it as a table for my laptop or just for writing and relaxing at the same time. What I want to warn everybody is there are magnets that keep the sliding parts in place and you need to be careful when you place your laptop over these strong magnets. (Small but strong)
customer_reviews.author: Constantin

customer_reviews.title: Decent lap desk
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent lap desk. Bottom of the legs and corners of the table were rough and would snag on my blanket when I used it in bed so I had to take some sandpaper to smooth them out. There are small magnets that are supposed to keep the side drawer and desk closed but they do not work. Every time I pick the table up to move it, I have to hold everything shut or else it will open up. Overall, the table is very useful, but does not seem like it was made very well.
customer_reviews.author: Juicy Jay

customer_reviews.title: Warm bamboo feeling (not plastic). Extremely versatile; reading, eating, drawing, and putting on makeup at eyelevel, etc.
customer_reviews.text: The small drawer is very handy. Along with our book holder we keep our back and head straight. We endure 27 kilos/59 pounds of a life time exposure to unnecessary cervical, thoracic, and lumbar stress (deformities and permanent damage). Let's read and use all of our devices, but at EYE LEVEL. Thank you Songmics and Amazon for making available!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo Bernal

customer_reviews.title: Don’t put heavy stuff on it.
customer_reviews.text: I left a ten pound item on the desk for a couple days and the wood gave and distorted. I got a replacement before because the surface wasn’t completely smooth and had the same issue with the other one that came in. I just sent back both. Also it’s just too short to sit under unless you’re maybe under 5 feet tall or a toddler. Pretty uncomfortable. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Good size and portable, good for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Good size and portable. I don't really like the silver locks which prevent the legs from folding in since they don't really stay in place. Adjusting for height is good and overall a good little table for work/gaming in bed or on the floor. It does chip slightly as I've noticed little bits on my sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a desk in my room so I bought this table for homework. It is a bit pricey for my budget BUT I highly recommend it. The material is great sturdy quality. The height can be adjusted. Great for writing and having your laptop on it as well. Looking forward to using it for homework next semester.
customer_reviews.author: Civallik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reading and computer table.
customer_reviews.text: Solid wood, cute split table design makes it convenient to read while your phone is next to you on the table. Has a little drawer which holds glasses, pens, highlighters very convenient. Works great. It is a bit heavy but not really an issue. Wish the book holder would go up a few notches further on the design, but just my personal preference. I would recommend it. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Avdreder

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pleased with my purchase. It's a sturdy piece, and has a couple different height positions (though I wish there was a third). There's enough room for a 17inch laptop but not much for the mouse if you use one. It folds up easily and makes reading, drawing or using the pc more comfortable in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Keaneau

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: The drawer gets stuck a lot and the little tab on the top meant to stop your laptop from sliding down ALWAYS falls out. Wish there was a way to keep it there permanently. It works well on a basic level, but the details make it hard to use
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: The table is great. First of all the desk came with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The table is great. First of all the desk came with the legs locked...I didn't know there was a lock so when I tried to open it I broke the lock but its still fixable. The reason for four stars instead of five is that 1: the wooden stand falls off way too easily and the legs are hard/annoying to adjust. Otherwise the table is sturdy and nice. It does say that the table may cause splinters however after having for a week and our family using it nobody has gotten a splinter.

Loved it so much I bought another one so i can have more books and papers propped up around me. Super sturdy and well-built. I think it is light weight and easy to lift on and off me as I get up and come back to it. I love how its easy to fold up and put away and leaves my room full of space if I want it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a laptop table during quarantine, as I transitioned to working from home. It comes already assembled, and sturdy. Easy to raise from a height used for a seated position to a height used for standing position. Large enough for me to place my laptop and notebook on to take notes while typing. Great quality. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Harris

customer_reviews.title: Love it

customer_reviews.author: Diana

Those for breakfast in bed may do well.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Great Desk for Multiple Uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these desks for my daughters (12, 15) at Christmas. They have been actively using them on a daily basis for the last month. Both girls have indicated that they really enjoy having their desks. This is a quality product for the price. i would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn K.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, versatile, I like it

Quality made, but these latches stink.
